description: Fill in your application for Authorised Economic Operator certificate online

sections.title: Eligibility checker

fields.infoText: Answer the following three questions to check if you are eligible to apply for AEO status:

fields.label: Is the business a legal entity?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether the business is a legal entity

fields.label: Is the business established in the territory of an European Union member state?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether the business is establised in the territory of an European Union member state

fields.label: Is the business actively involved in customs operations and international trade?
Does the economic entity applying have an Economic Operator Registration and Identification (EORI) number?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether the economic entity applying has an Economic Operator Registration and Identification number

sections.title: Eligibility checker passed

fields.label: Basic eligibility successfully passed
fields.infoText:
You have passed the basic eligibility checker. 

 Continue with the rest of the application form

sections.title: Eligibility checker failed

fields.infoText: You must not continue with the rest of your application until you can answer yes to all four questions on the previous page.

sections.title: Designated contact
sections.description: This is the point of contact for HMRC about the application.

sections.title: Your consent to use email

fields.infoText:
Email is not 100% secure, as it is sent over the internet.

This means it is possible for an email to be intercepted and altered.

Because of this, HMRC reduces the risk to your details wherever possible, for example by only quoting part of unique reference numbers.

We also make sure we only communicate with established business contacts at their correct email addresses.

fields.label: Do you agree to let us contact you by email about your application?
fields.errorMessage: Select whether you consent to being contacted using your email address
optionHelpText: If we need to contact you about your application, we will use the telephone number you have provided

sections.title: Border crossing information
sections.description: Enter the names or reference numbers of valid EU airports, ports or customs offices you regularly use to import, export or transit goods (up to a maximum of 5).

sections.title: Have any simplifications or facilitations already been granted?

fields.label: Have any simplifications or facilitations already been granted?
Examples of simplifications and facilitations
fields.infoText:
These can be safety certificates issued on the basis of international conventions:

* of an international standard of the international organisation for standardisation 

* or a European standard of a European standardisation bodies 

* or AEO-equivalent certificates issued in third countries

sections.title: Provide details of the main simplification or facilitation granted

fields.label: Code for the relevant customs procedure
fields.helpText: As used in the second or third subdivision of box 1 in the Single Administrative Document (SAD)

fields.label: Number of certificate for facilities already granted

sections.title: Information exchange consent

fields.label: I hereby give my consent to the exchange of the information in the AEO authorisation in order to ensure the implementation of international agreements with third countries on mutual recognition of the status of authorised economic operators and measures related to security.

sections.title: Information exchange consent details
What are your business activities?

fields.label: What are your business activities?
fields.helpText: Include the NACE code, for example: A1 Crop and animal production. You can get these from the EU Europa website.

sections.title: Do you consent to publication on the list of authorisation holders?

fields.label: Do you consent to publication on the list of authorisation holders?

sections.title: What is your business size?

fields.label: Business size information
fields.infoText:
micro – up to 10 staff with turnover of up to £2 million (or balance sheet total up to £2 million)

small – up to 50 staff with turnover of up to £10 million (or balance sheet total up to £10 million)

medium-sized – up to 250 staff with turnover of up to £50 million (or balance sheet total up to £43 million)

large – 250 or more staff with turnover of more than £50 million (or balance sheet total of more than £43 million)

sections.title: Financial accounts

fields.infoText:
Provide the last three years worth of audited accounts

 If your business is less than 3 years old submit accounts for the years that you have been trading 

 We accept documents in formats like pdf and jpeg (5mb maximum per upload).

fields.label: Upload your accounts for year 3
fields.errorMessage: Upload a file in the right format and size limit

sections.title: Are you ready to send this form?

fields.infoText:
You must complete form C118 to become an authorised economic operator.

You need to first send all relevant C118 forms, then send your C117.

We must receive everything within 24 hours, or your application will be rejected.

### If you are not ready to send all your forms within this period, you need to save and come back later.

fields.label: Provide details below of who is signing the declaration
Job title
fields.helpText: For example, director, financial controller or secretary

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will send an email to this address to confirm we’ve received this form

fields.infoText: By sending this form, you declare that the information you have provided is true and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted form.

You need to send us all of the relevant forms within **24 hours**.

If you do not send us these details in time, you will need to start a new application.

If you have sent us all the relevant details, we will tell you within 60 calendar days if your application has been successful.

If your application is unsuccessful we will tell you why.

**If you need help**

[Check the guidance](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/authorised-economic-operator-certification) to find out: 
- what you need to do while we process your application
- how to make changes to your application
- how to contact HMRC about your application
